item.title: Trees - Dead branches, 28th September

item.description:

item.title: Increasingly large pothole/crater, 28th September
item.description:
This pothole/crater has been there for many months, increasing in size and creating a real danger to cars as it’s on a junction that is already flagged as a dangerous bend. It appears to have been marked with green paint lines so hoping this is scheduled to be fixed very soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapel Hill, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report 8222600 does not need fixing read :_, 28th September
item.description:
There was a report put on yesterday ref 8222600 about a goose with a broken foot. This report does not need further action. This Canada goose is called Limpy and he lives at The Priory gardens. He is known to rescuers, he is an old goose and the foot cannot be fixed. He can fly in and out as he wishes as he is part of a flock and is regularly checked on by a group of volunteers. HE DOES NOT NEED RESCUING. It is in his interest to leave him amongst his flock and where he is constantly monitored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Hill, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
